Ongoing Research Projects.subtitle: at USC-ISI
Ongoing Research Projects.desc: Exploiting Context in Cartographic Evolutionary Documents to Extract and Build Linked Open Spatio-Temporal Data.

Ongoing Research Projects.title: Understanding Customer Requirements - an Enterprise Knowledge Graph Approach
Ongoing Research Projects.subtitle: with Dr. Anna Lisa Gentile, Mr. Chad DeLuca, Dr. Pengyuan Li and Dr. Guang-Jie Ren (IBM Research)
Ongoing Research Projects.desc: Leveraging linked open data and Enterprise Knowledge Graphs to guide the extraction and formalization of customer requirements from text.

Completed Research & Academic Projects.title: MINT (Model INTegration)
Completed Research & Academic Projects.subtitle: at USC-ISI
Completed Research & Academic Projects.desc: Scientific Model Integration through Knowledge-Rich Data and Process Composition.

publications.citation: Shbita, B., Vu, B., Feldman, D., Pham, M., Rajendran, A., Knoblock, C. A., Pujara, J., & Chiang, Y. Y. (2019). Creating a FAIR Data Catalog to Support Scientific Modeling. In Workshop on Advanced Knowledge Technologies for Science in a FAIR World (AKTS)

Completed Research & Academic Projects.title: Automated Generation of Control Concepts Annotation Rules Using Inductive Logic Programming
Completed Research & Academic Projects.subtitle: with Dr. Abha Moitra (GE Research)
Completed Research & Academic Projects.desc: Automatically generating classification and annotation rules for control concepts in cyber-physical systems (CPS) using semantic technologies and Inductive Logic Programming.

Completed Research & Academic Projects.title: Viola @ Socialbot Grand Challenge 4
Completed Research & Academic Projects.subtitle: university challenge to advance human-computer interaction (semi-finalists)
Completed Research & Academic Projects.desc: An open-domain dialogue system for spoken conversation that uses a topic-agnostic dialogue manager based on a simple generate-and-rank approach.

publications.citation: H. Cho, B. Shbita, K. Shenoy, S. Liu, N. Patel, H. Pindikanti, J. Lee, and J. May. (2021). Viola: A Topic Agnostic Generate-and-Rank Dialogue System. In Proceedings of the 4th Alexa Prize

Completed Research & Academic Projects.title: Augmenting Conversational Dialogue Datasets with Commonsense and Adaptive Local Knowledge
Completed Research & Academic Projects.subtitle: with Hyundong Cho (USC)
Completed Research & Academic Projects.desc:
Designed a dialogue dataset augmentation framework to expand multi-turn dialogue systems to incorporate external knowledge sources and ground pre-trained language models with commonsense reasoning.
Project conducted as part of the 'CSCI 662: Advanced Natural Language Processing' class.

Completed Research & Academic Projects.title: Robust Defense Against Lp-Norm-Based Attacks by Learning Robust Representations
Completed Research & Academic Projects.subtitle: with Iordanis Fostiropoulos, and Myrl Marmarelis (USC)
Completed Research & Academic Projects.desc:
Investigated the vulnerablity of image classifiers to adversarial perturbations and proposed a new regularization objective based on the Euclidean distance between classes in the hypothetical latent space found in the features of the penultimate layer.
Project conducted as part of the 'CSCI 699: Adversarial Machine Learning' class.

Completed Research & Academic Projects.title: Music Latent Representation and Disentanglement for Genre Classification
Completed Research & Academic Projects.subtitle: with Ehsan Qasemi, Binh Vu, and Minh Pham (USC)
Completed Research & Academic Projects.desc:
Investigated the use of unsupervised representation learning techniques to compress musical samples into a low-dimensional representation and use it for the task of music genre classification.
Project conducted as part of the 'CSCI 699: Representation Learning: Theory and Practice' class.

Completed Research & Academic Projects.title: Marvel and DC-Comics comic-books Knowledge Graph
Completed Research & Academic Projects.subtitle: Supervisors: Prof. Pedro Szekely, Dr. Jay Pujara (USC)
Completed Research & Academic Projects.desc:
Planned, designed, implemented and deployed a knowledge graph which captures Marvel and DC-Comics brands comic-book characters, comic-book issues and movies.
Project conducted as part of the 'INF 558/CSCI 563: Building Knowledge Graphs' class.

Completed Research & Academic Projects.title: IPoIB Router in the Switch-X Product Family: from Firmware Design to Implementation of the Verification Environment and the Debug Tools
Completed Research & Academic Projects.subtitle: under direction of Mr. Ami Marelli (Mellanox Technologies / Nvidia)
Completed Research & Academic Projects.desc:
Executed an implementation and verification process of the IPolB Router firmware mechanism in the Switch-X IC, a Switch System Silicon designed by Mellanox Technologies.
The development was done in the firmware layer using different methods and tools, according to the company’s required methodologies.

Completed Research & Academic Projects.title: Physical Design of 12-bit Two's Complement Adder
Completed Research & Academic Projects.subtitle: Supervisors: Prof. Yosi Shacham, Mr. Avi Efrati (Tel Aviv University)
Completed Research & Academic Projects.desc:
The project included hierarchical layout design, floorplanning, manual estimations and full layout simulations.
The Design was implemented using the 90nm Generic Process Design Kit (gpdk090) Technology and the gsclib090 library and was designed in Assura Virtuoso software.
Project conducted as part of the 'Introduction to VLSI design' course.

Completed Research & Academic Projects.title: Logic Design of Full Simplified DLX using FPGA
Completed Research & Academic Projects.subtitle: Supervisors: Mrs. Liron David, Mr. Marko Markov (Tel Aviv University)
Completed Research & Academic Projects.desc:
This project includes hardware design, implementation and debugging of a simple RISC processor (including data and control planes) on an FPGA development platform.
Used Xilinx software package and RESA software suite to code schematic and hardware description language (VHDL) designs and conduct logical simulations.
Project conducted as part of the 'Advanced Computer Structure Lab' course.

Completed Research & Academic Projects.title: Kiosk Management: A Thesis in Systems Design and Programming with Web Services
Completed Research & Academic Projects.subtitle: Supervisor: Mrs. Inessa Bolotin (Israel Arts and Science Academy)
Completed Research & Academic Projects.desc:
A user-friendly website for product purchasing.
The application features different levels of users and managers and enables them to view and add products to the catalog, prepare supplier-report and closely monitor expenses and revenues.
The system was used during senior high school year to raise money for students.

Completed Research & Academic Projects.title: Improving Text-Independent Speaker Identification Performance Using Gaussian Mixture Speaker Models
Completed Research & Academic Projects.subtitle: under direction of Dr. David Palmer (HP Autonomy)
Completed Research & Academic Projects.desc:
Studied Statistical Natural Language Processing, Automatic Speech Recognition and Machine Learning. Performed model training and testing with Python.
The research was conducted as part of the Research Science Institute (RSI), an intensive six-week program under sponsorship of the Center for Excellence in Education and hosted by the MIT.
